text: They are all academy of fine arts
public academy
but I got the permit of the academy in Toulouse first
and then Marseille
I applied for five and got two permits
You all applied for the same major?
This system doesn't seperate the majors
You passed the entrance exam
then select courses in 2nd grade
We study the general courses in 1st grade
Some academy
they have design major
or fine arts
only seperate out at 2nd grade
Have you already selected it?
Yes
In our school,there are design and fine arts majors
So you're in...
I'm now in fine arts
But in our major,they have options for the workshop
I'm in photography and installation art workshops
Photography and installation art
It means you have to work outside of the school?
For me,the school is only provide a place to study
where you have chances to exchange the notions with the profs
For your own art work
Whatever you do
they won't interfer you
they provide some materials and resources
you finished your work and discuss with your prof
so you're doing projects
in the workshops you mentioned?
Right
You have to work on a project in the workshop
and do it your own
You have complete freedom on the project
You can do whatever you want
same as your own creation
The prof won't interfer too much
The pricnipal is
propose your ideas
profs will give some advices
You can take them as references
During the process,
you can discuss with them and come out with new stuffs
You asked strangers on the road to shoot them
Yes in London
There're some people get pissed off?
That was in London
and I popped up with an idea
I felt London is a difference place
compare in France
Maybe tha's because I live in southern france
French are more warmth
London is a big city
People are more indifferent
They don't pay much attention on politeness
The day after my arrival is Xmas
so I have an idea to say I LOVE U
to show my warmth
I walk along the street
They don't have trasportation on Xmas
I went to a party of a friend
I have to walk about 2hrs
so I said I LOVE U to everyone on the street
While I'm talking,I took a pic of them too
in a close distance,about 1m
some people were nice
It won't cause a problem to them
some get angry
'Cause you didn't ask for their permission
Did someone wanna punch you?
Not really,but angry indeed
They didn't ask you to take out the roll?
I don't care,I left right away after shooting
Actually after I said Merry Xmas
I left immediately
some people will not be happy
if you take the photo then say (Merry Xmas)
They won't feel offended 'cause of Xmas
Westerners will be gentle (in Xmas)
How do you think about the photos after developing
I used an instamatic
I couldn't use a expensive one
Afraid of being smashed
That instamatic costs 10 pounds for one time
The definition is alright
Street snap doesn't concern about the definition
Anyway,it's fine
It captured the emotion I want
like astonishing
Some pics were taken at night
I walked along from afternoon to night
I used flash too
It catched some surprised facial expression
Not bad
How long have you been a photophile
one yr,two yrs?
Basically I use negatives
if we calculate from the time I use negatives
It's about 1 and half yr
1 and half
And you started to work on projects while you used negatives
Well for projects
it's a blurred line
In the beginning,I was messing around
It's about...
If we talk about the projects
maybe less than 1 yr
After (I used negatives for) 8 months
I started to have a concept about a series of projects
And for the first one?
The first one is still ongoing
still trying sth new
it's about portraits
Portraits on the street
I'm into street snap
and in the same time
I observe people in this process
for exemple,some clerks
or normal people
I'm interested in their outfits or anything elses
I will ask them (to do the photoshoot)
and write down their contacts
or send them the photos
sth like this
But your street snap is not like
I got a friend who is doing the street fashion snaps
with stylish people
but you are not
My street snap have a theme
Les gens moyennes
(it means)normal people
I'm not shooting the poors or riches
'Cause mostly it's the normal people who are supporting the society
Middle level
I want to present a feeling of normal people
It's just a feeling when I walk by them
or I sense sth which attract me to take the pics
You don't have to be stylish
or weird or sth elses
I depend on feelings or facial expression
I don't have a fix form,just to feel
You are not the one who are into wacks
instead the reality of daily life
My photos are like a dairy
Yours?
kind of
my own database
where I went to etc.
I'm lazy in writing
so photography is another expression of mine
not only use the negatives
I use my mobile a lot to record things
For your projects,mostly they don't district in a region?
You have a theme so wherever you go you shoot
Yes
Start from your first project
to the one you told me about the immigrants
It's the third or fifth?
Actually all of my projects are still ongoing
They only have the starts
but when will they end
I can't give you the answer,'cause it's continued
I'm doing them in the same time
I shoot the portraits continually
even I'm in Paris now,I continue
The immigrants one is just started
since the week before last week
What are the themes you have worked on?
which is interesting
My stuff is generally in experimental exploring
one of my project is human's back
from my classmates or students
They are not mature works
I'm still trying to break through this year
And for the immigrants
'Cause my best foreign friend in France is a turk
he treats me like his bro
Through his relations,we go out
and I also lived with him for a long time
We pray together
so I can understand a bit of his culture
And knowing some turks from him
or turkish immigrants born in France
I'm interested in their culture
so I began with turks
to make this project
Many photographers have the same theme in their time
In our time,there are more 2nd generation of immigrants
so that will be an issue for now
We're in a global village
the marriage (of different countries) or elses are nomal
The issue of 2nd or 3rd generation of the immigrants is important
so I want to discuss some problems in this project
through photography
For the answers,I won't tell
people can have explanations in the photos
I concern about how to present
the difference of culture/nation in a foreignland
or their 2nd generation born in another country
how to merge or exchange their culture and life style
In this project,you will focus on the turks
you won't explore the others?
Mainly turks now,'cause I got relations there
What I wanna do is
the observation between people from two different country as an outsider
For me,turkey is a different country
France is also different
I'm wondering how these two merge together
If I work on Taiwanese
then I'm not an outsider
I will block my vision without notice
so if I stand in a position of third party
I may easily find out sth they didn't notice before
It will be a better explanation for me
The audiences are also outsiders
Another perspective
Maybe this issue could be eaiser to express through photography
Not only the eastern element
The westerners might be interested in it
but too many people work on these
It just a...
Ok,What is eastern elements
It's hard to define
only if you show your own culture
maybe not culture,it's yourself
Human are the same
but everyone got different experiences
It's your own elements
only if you show this in your works
you will success once they accept this
to show a real status
to show yourself
but in the same time,it has to be interesting
it has some topics
Recent yrs in France
when I started to work on photography
Taiwan also has the trend of negatives
Many people into it
including China
The new generation of photographer
including Kechun Zhang
who won the discovery award of Arles this year
He also used negatives
Many photographers use negatives now
The mainly reason to use negatives is
in the very beginning of my digital experience
The camera on mobile is not very good
The definition is low
Photography is still a professional stuff for me
I could take pics which are very different to public with SLR
But now,the mobile can even achieve the level of SLR
It can be compared to digital camera
so it's important to find out the joy of photography
or we can just use the mobiles
I found negatives bring more photographic joy
or to express the meaning of photography
I found this out through negatives
When I'm doing the developping or press the button
It's a joy and also my expression of photography
My collection
I don't feel like a collector
Mostly of my collection is for pratical use
I treat myself as photophile not a photographer
'Cause I still have equipement enthusiasm
like many photophiles do
In the beginning,I used a camera from east germany which is not so good
I wanna change for a better one when working for a while
It's nice to have many flea markets in france
or photographic exhibitions you can find some cameras there
a cheap price with a nice camera
I buy sth good but actually I don't mind
if it has to be a good equipement
You can find the one you like
Find a camera which fits you after used many
For photo shooting,comfortable for you is all mattered
You don't have to own sth expensive
You use 120 and 135?
120 is more expensive
Only 12 negatives in a roll
For portraits,I use 120
Street snap,I use 135 for easily capture
You use flash or other equipement?
I don't really use flash and only use one lens
with 135,I have 40mm lens
That lens is cheap
'Cause mine is LEICA
I got a M6 and M3
M6 is great with photometry
I'm just begnning to use M3
try not to use the photometry
use my eye to mesure the light
try to expose in my own observation
I only have one lens right now
Two cameras can use it
so the lens of vintage camera can be used in common?
Yes if you bought in the same mark
depend on the types
The reason why I use RF
Photophiles knows RF is better for street snaps
'Cause I got shortsightedness but don't like to wear glasses
It's hard for me to focusing
For the focus of RF,just overlapping two shadows together
It's better for me to focusing
It has a skill of hyperfocal
You can manipulate the focus first
and just to catch a distance and shoot
so it's nice in street snaps
I won't do retouching on most of my pics
I will clean the dust on the negatives before scanning
I don't care even the dust has been scanned into the pics
I'll try not to use retouching
I don't like it
but many people use retouching now?
I have no objection on retouching
it depends
if you wanna present a photo prefectly
the retouching might be important
like the color tone in stuff
indeed it's necessary
But I want my pics present their original
Why I use negatives
and why I don't like retouching
only through negatives developping ,you can see how exposure principle works in photography
If you do retouching,that's like a digital pic for me
so I try to show the original of negatives
In competition,there are some people will use this?
They won't district on retouching in France
Maybe some of the competition will
but for those I knew,they won't
Developping is a process
After shooting,the photography is not ended
Retouching,no,developping
This kind of process and you print out
They are all in photography
Only if you print out your negatives,it's the end
If sth wrong in the process,the whole pic is ruined
That's a joy for me to get through the process of negative developping
Did you try any effect when developping or just normal print out?
I use normal way
I don't like the effects either
I tried to add some effect of bubbles before
I'm not into it after I've tried
Maybe in the future I will try again
but now,I just shoot and print out
more traditional
You can accept on the spend of the negatives in France?
so far so good
so you'll work on this budget continually
I didn't spend too much actually
It depends if I go out or not
If I travel for a long time,it might spend a little on photo shooting
Basically I'm in Marseille to live
not whole time for my works
Not too much
In school
they have developping water for BW
I'm ok with the spend of negatives
but it will be a problem if I leave my school
I might keep some camera of mine to shoot BW
I'll do the developping myself
The color pics will stop probably
I spend my 70% time of photography
30% on installation art
I wanna try installation art
I don't wanna learn photography at first
yet still got interest
so I chose the workshop of photography
Installation art is a new stuff for me ,still have to keep working
